intro: Matelea corrugata, commonly known as the wrinkled matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. Matelea corrugata thrives in rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments.
